quiz.title: Which tech career path is right for me?
quiz.subtitle: And the resources to get you there...

questions.text: Curious - inspire me with some fancy links....
questions.alt: Beautiful and colourful garden area with a painted mural that says INSPIRE

questions.text: Newbie - I'm ready to explore, show me the options!
questions.alt: An organised desk with rose gold stationery

questions.text: Career Switcher - where do I start?
questions.alt: Bright blue painted brick wall with a white arrow pointing right
A monitor with colourful lines of code

content.text: Which area are you most interested in exploring?

questions.alt: Software Engineer sitting in a cafe with a laptop
Data Scientist standing by servers on a laptop
Slogan that reads I feel like makin' dreams come true

combination: Curious - inspire me with some fancy links....
answers.alt: Software engineer working across multiple monitors
answers.resources: This could be a great choice if you enjoy problem-solving and developing creative tech solutions. Software Engineering covers a broad range of languages, job opportunities and industries including software engineer, full-stack developer, AI, Machine Learning, DevOps, Solutions Architect, QA, Agile / Scrum and more! Check out the links below:
answers.title1: Code First Girls - amazing community, resources and courses
answers.title2: Free Code Camp - it's really free!
answers.title4: Le Wagon - a highly rated bootcamp
answers.title5: Connect with a community on Discord

combination: Newbie - I'm ready to explore, show me the options!
answers.alt: Stadtbibliothek library, floors and floors of books
answers.resources: Data is everywhere! Much like software, a data career pathway opens up a range of roles across different industries. Good at finding patterns in data or discovering insights that can help steer decision-making? This could be a career to explore so check out the links below:
answers.title1: Data Camp - amazing community, resources and courses
answers.title3: CodeAcademy - try a free Python course for beginners
answers.title4: Le Wagon - a highly rated bootcamp

combination: Career Switcher - where do I start?
answers.alt: Stack of books on product management
answers.resources: Product designers use design skills and coding knowledge to improve the way that existing products work. If you have creative ideas about how apps and websites can have better functionality or design, product & design is for you! Here are some links to get started:
answers.title1: Free UX Design course on CodeAcademy
answers.title2: Figma design tutorial on Free Code Camp
answers.title4: Thinking about Product Management? Check out this course
answers.title5: Connect with a community on Discord

answers.alt: Two people meeting and for a mentoring session
answers.resources: Sharing your experience, knowledge, and connections to help graduates or career switchers can have a huge impact! Thank you for exploring this route:
answers.title1: Become a mentor at Meet a Mentor
answers.title2: Read more about being a great mentor on LinkedIn
answers.title3: Partner with a great organisation to support the next generation in tech
answers.title4: Share your knowledge at a MeetUp
